newsitem.title: TAJIKISTAN: U.N. aid workers disappear in Tajik capital.
newsitem.headline: U.N. aid workers disappear in Tajik capital.

text.p: A Nigerian national and three local staff working for the United Nations refugee agency (UNHCR) in Tajikistan went missing in the centre of the capital Dushanbe on Thursday morning, a UNHCR source said.
"They were stopped in their vehicles on Rudaki Avenue at 8.30 (0330 GMT) this morning," the UNHCR source told Reuters in Dushanbe. "We have had no radio contact with them since then."

The identities of the kidnappers were not known. An armed rebel group this week seized four U.N. military observers from Austria, Switzerland and Ukraine, two Red Cross workers and four Russian reporters.
The rebels are commanded by Rizvon Sadirov, who used to fight for Tajikistan's Islamic opposition but whose loyalties are now unclear.

The rebels want safe passage for members of the group based in neighbouring Afghanistan back into the former Soviet republic, an impoverished, mountainous country wracked by civil war which also borders China.

The U.N. and the International Committee of the Red Cross have condemned the kidnappings and have demanded the hostages' immediate release. Local staff at both agencies have been told to stay at home until Monday.
